nodes.text: Philap Bygar

Philap Bygar was a human male general in the Rebel Alliance who was present at Echo Base on the planet Hoth during the Galactic Civil War. In 3 ABY, he greeted members of the Alliance's 61st Mobile Infantry, also referred to as Twilight Company who were escorting the Imperial defector, Governor Everi Chalis. Bygar made sure to commend the unit for its accomplishments.

When one Twilight Company member, First Sergeant Hazram Namir, became involved in a fight at the base, Bygar disciplined the soldier but did not inform Captain Micha Evon. Soon after, the Galactic Empire invaded the base, scattering the Alliance. Bygar died and his death was reported sometime after to Namir when he contacted a rebel relay station.
Biography
Meeting Chalis

Philap Bygar was a human male who served as a general in the Rebel Alliance against the Galactic Empire during the Imperial Era. In 3 ABY, he was at Echo Base, the Alliance High Command's secret base on the planet Hoth. He went to meet Everi Chalis, a defector Imperial governor under the custody of the Alliance's 61st Mobile Infantry, better known as Twilight Company, who had been invited for a strategy conference held by the High Command. Back by three armed guards, Bygar met Chalis upon her arrival. Chalis, handcuffed per the High Command's conditions, came with Micha Evon, the captain of Twilight Company, and an escort comprising of First Sergeant Hazram Namir and two other rebel troopers.

Bygar introduced himself to the members of Twilight Company, leading up to Chalis. He acknowledged the former governor's work as an artist and with the Imperial Ruling Council. Chalis pointed out her cuffs and the general told her the Alliance believed in redemption. Bygar further commended Twilight Company for being able to survive some tough assignments, citing the times the company was sent to the terrestrial worlds Praktin and Blacktar Cyst. After expressing his gratefulness for the group's service, Bygar then informed Chalis and Evon's escort that they were to be put to work, assuring that they could only make being on Hoth more liveable.
Death

Two days later, Namir was involved in a fight with the Alliance Special Forces soldier Kryndal. Bygar greeted him the next morning at the medical center, where he expressed his disappointment with the First Sergeant. The general further explained to Namir that Evon had not been informed of his behaviour, which Namir was grateful for. Thus Bygar punished him, with the approval of the medical staff, by assigning the First Sergeant to carry shipping crates from the hangar bays to the bases interior.
When holojournalist Corwi Selgrothe arrived at Echo Base to record stories of the Rebellion, she reported to the General. Bygar welcomed her, and then passed her off to Toryn Farr for a briefing.

After another two days, the Empire attacked the Alliance at Hoth. The Alliance was on the run thereafter and High Command was scattered. Bygar himself died, and news of this reached Namir later that year when the First Sergeant contacted a rebel at a relay station shortly before Twilight Company attacked the planet Sullust.
Personality and traits

Philap Bygar was had pale skin and graying hair with a thick mustache. He held high hopes for the Imperial defector Chalis and assured her that the Alliance believed in redemption. Bygar gave many complements to the members of Twilight Company and kept Hazram Namir's bad behaviour a secret from his captain, Micha Evon.
Equipment
Bygar wore a heavily padded jacket that had a hood and the rank insignia of an Alliance general.
Behind the scenes
Philap Bygar first appeared in the 2015 novel Battlefront: Twilight Company, written by Alexander Freed.
